newsitem.title: USA: RESEARCH ALERT - Bradesco upgraded to buy.
newsitem.headline: RESEARCH ALERT - Bradesco upgraded to buy.

text.p: -- Caspian Securities said in a report it had raised its rating on Brazilian private bank Bradesco to buy from market performer.
-- "We are upgrading Bradesco ... in light of the bank's current depressed valuation and expectation of a 43 percent appreciation in price in fiscal year 1997," it said.
-- Bradesco's price has dropped 10 percent and it has underperformed the local market by 37 percent since Caspian cut its rating on the bank on May 8, Caspian said.
-- "This was probably due to the uncertainties related to the timing of the decline in interest rates," it said.
-- Bradesco is Brazil's largest private bank.
-- Caspian said Bradesco's expected strong earnings growth of 16 percent a year during 1997-98 is not fully reflected in its current valuation.
-- Earnings growth will be driven by increases in credit volumes, which will offset an expected decline in net interest margin, it said.
-- "Bradesco's most important strengths are its large capital structure and diversified revenue stream," the report said.
-- Its chief weaknesses, it said, are asset quality deterioration and increased competition from foreign institutiions.
-- But asset quality should stabilize by mid-1997 and foreign bank competition should not hurt the bank, it said.
-- Bradesco preferred was off 0.02 reais at 7.28 reais, while its common voter was down 0.06 reais at 6.76 reais at 1352 local/1552 GMT on the Sao Paulo bolsa.
